bug.author: dorintt
bug.description:
First, training with web app: <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/40022306/75624966-39d0f500-5bc2-11ea-82aa-ae52a5e6877f.JPG></denchmark-link>
Then training with cacli: <denchmark-code>$ cacli train
Bucket panels-01
⠏ Starting training run... error Backend response timeout (30s) </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-code>$ cacli list ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── name model id status submitted panels-01 model-1qn1nzc4 error an hour ago panels-01 model-mno1p33h error an hour ago panels-01 model-y7lg8gi8 error an hour ago panels-01 model-z9od9ow4 error 36 minutes ago panels-01 model-2iwj18c1 error 30 minutes ago </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-code>$ cacli logs model-1qn1nzc4 error NoSuchKey: The specified key does not exist. status code: 404, request id: 70e8fc34-d48d-4055-9eaf-a2ea61703910, host id: </denchmark-code>

comments.comment: That error shouldn't have anything to do with your data. I think I've seen that error before when my bucket endpoint had a typo when I was manually testing the api, but the endpoint is autogenerated for you, so you shouldn't have to worry about that. Do you know what region your bucket is in?

I am on the Lite plans for now, and I just selected the defaults for services. From IBM cloud: <denchmark-code>Services(1) Machine Learning-2z Default London Machine Learning Active
Storage(1) Cloud Object Storage-vz Default Global Cloud Object Storage Provisioned </denchmark-code>
However, my panels-01 bucket is in us-geo location with this endpoint s3.us.cloud-object-storage.appdomain.cloud. I don't think I could have selected an European location with the Lite plan.
hmm, that looks good to me
I am getting exactly the same error...

I think I found the problem. The machine learning service is set to London location by default, while the storage is in the US. I deleted the ML service and created a new one in Dallas location, I am no longer getting the error , the message now says "Waiting for an available GPU (this may take a while)..." which seems to be normal.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/playrobotics-alex>@playrobotics-alex</denchmark-link> That's good to know! I will look into if using buckets in another region effect training, or if there is just an issue with the London region of Watson Machine Learning. If it says Waiting for an available GPU (this may take a while)... that means the training job was successfully submitted :)
I believe the issue is with the WML London instance, I'm not able to get any bucket to train with a london instance
The issue with London has been resolved, training should work now :)
